content:
Macaque approached Nezha, holding the diamond snare necklace tightly in his hand. Nezha's eyes widened as he saw it, and he turned to MK.

"MK, do you know what that is?" he asked, pointing to the necklace.

MK shook his head, still in shock from the battle.

"That is the diamond snare necklace," Nezha explained. "It's said to be the only thing that can bind Wukong."

Macaque nodded. "And I got it from him," he said, his voice shaking with emotion.

Nezha looked at Macaque with respect. "You are a brave and powerful monkey," he said.

Macaque bowed his head humbly. "I only did what I had to do to protect my friend," he said.

MK was amazed to see the two monkeys talking like old friends. "You two know each other?" he asked.

Nezha chuckled. "Yes, we go way back," he said. "Macaque was one of the monkeys I trained in the art of combat."

Macaque smiled at the memory. "Those were good times," he said. "You taught us well, Nezha."

Nezha turned to MK. "Macaque is one of the greatest warriors I've ever known," he said. "You're lucky to have him as a friend."

MK nodded, feeling a deep sense of gratitude toward Macaque. "I know," he said. "I don't know what I would have done without him."

Macaque put his arm around MK. "Don't worry, little buddy," he said. "I'll always be here for you."

Nezha smiled at the two of them. "You two are a great team," he said. "Together, you can accomplish anything."

MK smiled, feeling a sense of pride in his friendship with Macaque. He knew that with him by his side, he could face any challenge that came his way.
